speaker: Appearances
text: [[7.01]](/frasier/transcripts/season_7/episode_1/momma_mia.html "Momma Mia") Momma Mia   Frasier's first wife, a Raffi-like children's entertainer.   _"She's a one-time Boston barmaid who had a nervous breakdown and ended up in a sanitorium, where I met her, fell for her, and then was so mercilessly rejected by her that to this day there is a sucking chest wound where once there dwelled a heart!"_ - Frasier, explaining Diane to Daphne

speaker: Appearances
text: [[2.09]](/frasier/transcripts/season_2/episode_9/adventures_in_paradise_2.html "Adventures In Paradise \[2\]") Adventures In Paradise [Part II] [[3.14]](/frasier/transcripts/season_3/episode_14/the_show_where_diane_comes_back.html "The Show Where Diane Comes Back") The Show Where Diane Comes Back  _"Strange, I usually get some sign when Lilith is in town - dogs forming into packs, blood weeping down the wall..."_ - Niles on Lilith  Frasier's second wife (also a psychiatrist), and the mother of his son Frederick.

speaker: Appearances
text: [[1.16]](/frasier/transcripts/season_1/episode_16/the_show_where_lilith_comes_back.html "The Show Where Lilith Comes Back") The Show Where Lilith Comes Back [[2.08]](/frasier/transcripts/season_2/episode_8/adventures_in_paradise_1.html "Adventures In Paradise \[1\]") Adventures In Paradise [Part I] [[2.09]](/frasier/transcripts/season_2/episode_9/adventures_in_paradise_2.html "Adventures In Paradise \[2\]") Adventures In Paradise [Part II] [[4.07]](/frasier/transcripts/season_4/episode_7/a_lilith_thanksgiving.html "A Lilith Thanksgiving") A Lilith Thanksgiving [[5.15]](/frasier/transcripts/season_5/episode_15/room_service.html "Room Service") Room Service [[7.09]](/frasier/transcripts/season_7/episode_9/the_apparent_trap.html "The Apparent Trap") The Apparent Trap [[8.24]](/frasier/transcripts/season_8/episode_24/cranes_go_caribbean.html "Cranes Go Caribbean") Cranes Go Caribbean  The prom queen at Frasier's high school.  Still beautiful, but possessed of a volcanic temper and the voice of an air raid siren.

speaker: Appearances
text: [[7.14]](/frasier/transcripts/season_7/episode_14/big_crane_on_campus.html "Big Crane On Campus") Big Crane On Campus [[8.21]](/frasier/transcripts/season_8/episode_21/semi_decent_proposal_1.html "Semi-Decent Proposal \[1\]") Semi-Decent Proposal [[8.22]](/frasier/transcripts/season_8/episode_22/a_passing_fancy_2.html "A Passing Fancy \[2\]") A Passing Fancy [[8.23]](/frasier/transcripts/season_8/episode_23/a_day_in_may.html "A Day in May") A Day In May [[8.24]](/frasier/transcripts/season_8/episode_24/cranes_go_caribbean.html "Cranes Go Caribbean") Cranes Go Caribbean  The "perfect" woman for Frasier (she actually has more in common with him than Niles does, if you can believe that).

speaker: Appearances
text: [[8.21]](/frasier/transcripts/season_8/episode_21/semi_decent_proposal_1.html "Semi-Decent Proposal \[1\]") Semi-Decent Proposal [[8.22]](/frasier/transcripts/season_8/episode_22/a_passing_fancy_2.html "A Passing Fancy \[2\]") A Passing Fancy [[8.24]](/frasier/transcripts/season_8/episode_24/cranes_go_caribbean.html "Cranes Go Caribbean") Cranes Go Caribbean    * * *  ## Transcript {Mike Lee}    [_N.B. The title of this episode is based on a title card from Episode 5.19, "Frasier Gotta Have It"_]  **PREVIOUSLY ON FRASIER**  _Scenes From "Cranes Go Caribbean"  Claire and Frasier in their hotel room:_

speaker: Claire
text: I'm crazy about you.  I just started to feel like you didn't want to be here with me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh gosh, nothing could be further from the truth.  _They hug.  CUT TO:  Frasier and Claire in bed together:_

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll tell you something else.  I'm happy.  _He rolls over in bed.  The woman next to him rolls over - it is now Lana._

speaker: Lana
text: I'm glad, Frasier.  I'm happy, too.  _They kiss and embrace.  CUT TO:  Frasier on the phone in the hotel lobby:_

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm on vacation with my girlfriend, Claire - a woman who, by all conventional measures, is "perfect" for me.  And yet I've just had a vivid, sexual dream about someone who differs from her entirely. [ ] It's a woman named Lana... _FADE TO:  ACT ONE_ **HELL ON WHEELS** _Scene One - Frasier's BMW Frasier is driving along a country road.  Seated beside and in back of him, respectively, are Lilith and Diane._

speaker: Diane
text: Excuse me, but why do I have to sit in the back seat? Seriously, my legs are starting to cramp back here-

speaker: Lilith
text: Seriously, why is she here at all?

speaker: Diane
text: I have just as much right to be here as you!

speaker: Lilith
text: "Here" doesn't mean the front seat!

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, listen, ladies, we've got about an hour to go. I would like to have a little quiet, I'm going to turn on some music.  _Frasier turns on an opera station.  FADE TO:_  **ONE WEEK EARLIER IN BELIZE** _Scene Two - Hotel Restaurant Martin, Daphne, and Claire are eating brunch together.  Niles joins them.  He is now sporting a bushy goatee._  [_N.B. Odd, in light of Niles's past comic attempts to grow a mustache. See[[4.22]](/frasier/transcripts/season_4/episode_22/are_you_being_served.html "Are You Being Served?"), "Are You Being Served?" and [[6.20]](/frasier/transcripts/season_6/episode_20/dr_nora.html "Dr. Nora"), "Dr. Nora."_]

speaker: Niles
text: Morning, gang. [_they all ad-lib hellos_]

speaker: Daphne
text: How's my natural man?

speaker: Niles
text: Mmm, as hungry as I am hairy. [_kisses her_]

speaker: Claire
text: No kidding, that goatee sure came in fast.

speaker: Niles
text: I know.  I credit the hothouse atmosphere of this tropical paradise -- that and our nearly constant nudity. [_Daphne chuckles_] Gone is the citified dandy of just last week. In his place stands a feral Caliban, a sandy-bottomed Dionysius, a lusty, insatiable - ooh, scones!

speaker: Waiter
text: Here is your special order.

speaker: Claire
text: Thank you.

speaker: Martin
text: I'm starving.  Claire and I have been up fishing since 5 A.M.

speaker: Daphne
text: You've already got more fish than we could eat in a year.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, we didn't just fish!  We went for a swim, we explored some caves, and watched a school of dolphins-

speaker: Claire
text: But the best part was when he taught me how to hypnotize a lobster.

speaker: Daphne
text: You what?

speaker: Martin
text: It's all in the eyes.

speaker: Claire
text: Hey, Marty, try this. [_offers a bite of pancake_]

speaker: Martin
text: [_eats it_] Mmm, not bad!  Hey Niles, try this pancake!  Claire had them crumble the bacon right into the batter.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I don't really like pancakes.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, that's 'cause you're used to Daphne's.  Here.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, those are magnificent!

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah!  And Claire invented them!

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes, no doubt on the seventh day while You were resting. [_laughs_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Good morning, all. [_everyone greets him_]

speaker: Claire
text: Hello, my sweet darling man.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_kisses her_] Hello... kiddo.

speaker: Daphne
text: So, have they found your luggage yet, Dr. Crane?

speaker: Frasier
text: If they had, would I be wearing this shirt three days in a row?  Huh, fat chance.

speaker: Photographer
text: Souvenir of your stay?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, sure!

speaker: Frasier
text: By all means.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, this is a brunch to remember.

speaker: Niles
text: It's not a vacation until Dad takes a picture of one of his meals. _They pose on one side of the table - Daphne with her arm around Niles, Martin with his arm around Claire, Frasier hunching over them all. The photographer takes the picture._

speaker: Frasier
text: Very good!  Thank you very much, well done. [_tips him_]

speaker: Photographer
text: You can pick them up at the front desk.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.

speaker: Claire
text: [_gets up_] Well, sorry to run off, but I have to finish packing.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right.

speaker: Claire
text: I'll see you up at the room.

speaker: Frasier
text: OK. _They kiss, and Claire leaves.  Everyone ad-libs goodbyes. Frasier sits down._

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, she's a real find, Fras.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, she is, isn't she? [_waves the photographer back_] Oh, excuse me?

speaker: Photographer
text: Yes?

speaker: Frasier
text: Do you think we could have another picture, of just the family?

speaker: Photographer
text: No problem.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, what about Claire?  She's practically family.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, very much so, but there may come a time when... say, she isn't. _They pose as before (minus Claire), and the photographer takes the picture._

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you again.

speaker: Martin
text: [_checks his watch_] Oh, hey!  We better get going, Daph. We got fish to pack! [_he and Daphne get up_] Oh, and I didn't fillet 'em, because Claire said you can use the heads for soup!

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, when I'm chopping them off, I'll be thinking of her.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, listen, I didn't want to say anything in front of the others, but I find myself in a bit of a quandary.  Well, it's not so much a quandary, really, it's more of, uh, a pickle.  Well, not so much a pickle, but well, but, no more than a, a... a cornichon.

speaker: Niles
text: What is it?

speaker: Frasier
text: I think I want to be with Lana, not Claire.

speaker: Niles
text: Forgive me, Frasier, but that's one big-ass cornichon.

speaker: Frasier
text: I know, I know.  I'm having a perfectly wonderful time with Claire, it's just that my mind keeps drifting back to Lana.

speaker: Niles
text: For God's sake, why?  She's loud, she's crass-

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes, but she's also challenging, and sexy, and exciting. I'm just afraid I may have let go of that too hastily.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, you do this every time.  You are in a great relationship with Claire.  Don't overthink it.  Embrace it.

speaker: Frasier
text: You're right, Niles.  Thank you.  Yes, I should just go with it.  Gosh, I don't know what's wrong with me.  I don't know why I keep insisting on overanalyzing everything.

speaker: Martin
text: [_whispering_] Because you're crazy, that's why! _They are on the plane returning to Seattle.  Frasier is sitting across from Martin, Claire is asleep in the seat next to him. Martin leans back to allow a woman to walk down the aisle, then leans forward again._

speaker: Martin
text: Claire's perfect for you, but I like her too!  How many times does that happen?

speaker: Frasier
text: But what about Lana?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, forget Lana!  Stay with Claire. [_stares at Frasier, chanting_] Stay-with-Claire.  Stay-with-Claire.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, I am not a lobster.  Of course I'm going to stay with Claire.  I was just going through some momentary doubts, and I needed your guidance.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, glad you got what you needed.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.  I feel completely at ease now.  No more doubts, no more nagging questions.  I'm just being a little overly cautious, that's all.

speaker: Daphne
text: Who could blame you?

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm not sure about Claire either.  God knows she has quite the fan club around here, but I think you can do much better. You'll know when you meet the right person.  You feel it in your gut.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's true.  But you see, I don't want to feel like I'm leading her on.  Maybe I should just tell her what I'm going through.  You know, be completely honest.

speaker: Guy
text: Whoa, that's just what you don't want to do. _The plane is now on the ground and empty, except for Frasier and the Maintenance Guy._

speaker: Frasier
text: So, you vote for Claire?

speaker: Guy
text: I don't know.  Lana has her good points.  And don't underestimate the crush you had on her in 11th grade. But Claire can give you sophisticated conversation. And she leaves a clean area! _He motions to Claire's seat, where the pillow and blanket are neatly folded._

speaker: Guy
text: I don't envy you your choice.  Lift your feet, please. _Frasier does, allowing the Maintenance Guy to vacuum the floor under them.  FADE TO:  Scene Two - Cafe Nervosa Roz is reading at a table.  Niles, wearing shorts, a tropical shirt, and his beard, gets his coffee from the counter._

speaker: Niles
text: Excuse me, miss, do you have the time?

speaker: Roz
text: [_glances up, then checks her watch_] Yes, it's- [_double-take_] Niles?

speaker: Niles
text: [_Jamaican accent_] Ya, mon!

speaker: Roz
text: You look... did you get hit on the head by a coconut?

speaker: Niles
text: The coconut of revelation.  I discovered a whole new side of myself in Belize, and I'm not going to abandon Island Niles just 'cause my vacation's over.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, Island Niles might want to rethink the short pants.

speaker: Niles
text: Island Niles would prefer not to wear pants at all.  You should have seen us, Roz - out in the elements, nothing on our bodies but sunblock 120.  It was exhilarating and primal, and... frankly, it's disappointing to have to strap myself back into these fabric shackles.

speaker: Roz
text: So you're going to be spending your time at the nude beach now?

speaker: Niles
text: Seattle has a nude beach?

speaker: Roz
text: Well, not officially, but just south of Alki, there's this little strip near the White House.

speaker: Niles
text: Thanks for the tip, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Here's another one: don't go on Thursdays, it's Senior Volleyball Day.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh well, Roz, I see you've met Island Niles.  At least he did you the courtesy of putting a shirt on.

speaker: Niles
text: [_proudly_] I'm still not wearing underpants.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to the counter person_] May I have a latte, please? [_sits down_] Well, Roz, you'll be pleased to know I have come to a decision: Claire it is; So long, Lana!

speaker: Roz
text: Are you sure?

speaker: Frasier
text: Trust me, Roz.  The brain is racked, the soul is searched, the window is closed.  Claire in, Lana out.

speaker: Roz
text: I'm glad to hear it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: Lana
text: Hey, Roz.  Hi, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Lana, uh, hi, uh... hello.

speaker: Lana
text: Wow, you look great.

speaker: Frasier
text: Not as great as you do.  I mean, thanks.

speaker: Kirby
text: Hey, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Kirby.

speaker: Kirby
text: It's been too long.

speaker: Roz
text: No, it hasn't.

speaker: Kirby
text: Or has it?

speaker: Roz
text: No.

speaker: Frasier
text: So, what brings you here?

speaker: Lana
text: Well, actually we just picked up the invitations for Kirby's graduation party.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh!

speaker: Lana
text: Roz, you're invited too.  After all, you motivated Kirby to study.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, no, Frasier was the one who helped him.  I was just his last-minute prom date.

speaker: Kirby
text: You were the prize that I kept my eyes on!  And, uh, for your FYI, I'm cool for hanging out, just as platatonic friends, or whatever.

speaker: Lana
text: Um, Kirby, we should go if we're gonna pick up your inhaler.

speaker: Kirby
text: Thanks a lot, Mom! [_to Roz_] I only need it in the fall.

speaker: Lana
text: Well, we'll see you at the party.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right.

speaker: Lana
text: Hey, Frasier, don't you be a stranger.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, no, I-I won't.  Uh, don't you be a stranger, either. To me.

speaker: Roz
text: Let me guess: Lana in, Claire out.

speaker: Frasier
text: What, that?  Oh, that was nothing.  It's just, she merely caught me off guard.  Don't go reading anything into that.

speaker: Roz
text: OK, if you say so. [_gets up_] Listen, Frasier, I got to go.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, alright.

speaker: Roz
text: But let not... either us... be strangers... be. _She touches his shoulder flirtatiously and leaves.  Frasier chafes.  FADE TO:  Scene Three - Airport Storage Room Frasier is standing at the counter.  A luggage clerk hauls in a large bag._

speaker: Clerk
text: Oh, I apologize for the inconvenience, but, uh, at least there's a happy ending, right?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_sarcastic_] My suitcase is inside this to keep it safe?

speaker: Clerk
text: So...

speaker: Frasier
text: That is not my bag.

speaker: Clerk
text: Right.  I'll keep looking.

speaker: Man
text: Have you been waiting here long?

speaker: Frasier
text: Time is irrelevant here in the Seventh Circle of Hell -- a place where even despair dies.  Prepare yourself for a lifetime...

speaker: Man
text: Oh, here it is!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, how nice for you. _The man picks up one of two suitcases sitting by the counter. He turns to go, but stops._

speaker: Man
text: Hey, you're Dr. Frasier Crane, aren't you?  I'm a big fan!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_shakes his hand_] Oh, it's always nice to meet a fan.

speaker: Man
text: Yeah, thanks.  Hey, do you give advice, you know, off the clock?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, this isn't really a good time.

speaker: Man
text: Well, because I've really gotten my life into a tangle.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry.

speaker: Man
text: No, but, you see, I'm torn between these two women!

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm listening.

speaker: Man
text: I'm with this woman, her name's Kathy, she's great.  But the only problem is, I can't stop thinking about my ex.  I mean, she was a real handful, but now that we're apart, I just miss her like crazy.

speaker: Frasier
text: Of course you do!  And no matter how hard you try to focus on this new relationship, your mind keeps drifting back to her.

speaker: Man
text: Exactly!  I mean, I even have these, um...

speaker: Frasier
text: Dreams!

speaker: Man
text: Yes!  Wow, you're good.  What should I do?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, what are you thinking of doing?

speaker: Man
text: Classic shrink response.  Um, I'm thinking... do I really want to break things off with this woman?

speaker: Frasier
text: Who you thought was so perfect for you.

speaker: Man
text: OK, but how perfect could she be if I'm obsessing about another woman?

speaker: Frasier
text: That's the conundrum!

speaker: Man
text: I know, but am I sure enough to break her heart?

speaker: Frasier
text: Especially when the rest of the family just loved her.

speaker: Man
text: Yeah- no, they don't.

speaker: Frasier
text: Alright, stick with me, stick with me.  It all boils down to this: which of these two women do you see spending the rest of your life with?

speaker: Man
text: Right.  Right, of course.  Well, I think it's pretty obvious what I have to do.  What a relief!  Thanks, Doc. [_starts to leave_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Wait, wait!  Let's go back!  Just so I'm sure you're sure-

speaker: Man
text: Yeah.

speaker: Frasier
text: Who are you picking?

speaker: Man
text: My ex!  I mean, if I'm really honest with myself, she's the one I love.  As long as I stay with Kathy, I'm just being a jerk.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, well, to be fair, you have struggled with these issues.

speaker: Man
text: No, I've really just been trying to have my cake and eat it too. [_shakes his hand_] Thanks, Dr. Crane.  I know what I have to do now. _The Man leaves.  Frasier seems to have made his decision.  END OF ACT ONE  ACT TWO  Scene Four - Apartment Martin is finishing a sandwich in his Armchair.  Daphne comes in the door with the groceries._

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm sorry I'm a little late, I'll start your lunch right away.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, no need.  Claire made the best deviled ham sandwich in the history of deviling.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, too bad.  I missed her.

speaker: Martin
text: Mm, more good news!  She's still here.

speaker: Claire
text: Here you go, Marty.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, thanks, toots.

speaker: Daphne
text: Claire!  I can't imagine you came all the way over here just to make sandwiches.

speaker: Claire
text: Oh, no.  Here, let me take those. [_takes the groceries_] I'm making fish jerky. [_heads back to the kitchen, but stops_] You know the secret to making fish jerky, don't you, Marty?

speaker: Martin
text: No idea.

speaker: Claire
text: Feed 'em coffee.

speaker: Martin
text: Feed 'em...? [_laughs uproariously, Claire laughs with him_] That's terrific!  You hear that, Daph?

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm standing right here.

speaker: Martin
text: Don't you love her laugh?  It's like music.

speaker: Claire
text: Marty, you are just the sweetest! [_goes to the kitchen_]

speaker: Daphne
text: You used to think my accent sounded musical, didn't you... Marty?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, but now I'm used to it.

speaker: Niles
text: Afternoon, Daphne, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: Niles.

speaker: Daphne
text: What happened to my noble savage?

speaker: Niles
text: [_hangs up his coat_] I'll tell you what happened.  Roz told me about this wonderful nude beach, so I went down there this morning to check it out for us.  Well, it was so peaceful I decided to do my sunrise Tai Chi, have my naked body caressed by the rosy fingers of the new dawn, you know?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, jeez.  [_N.B. Niles's last phrase is an oft-repeated line from Homer._]

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I left my clothing and my cares in the car, walked down to the beach and settled in for my first exercise, "Grasping the Bird's Tail." _He raises his arms in a martial arts pose.  Daphne nods and mirrors him._

speaker: Niles
text: Just at that moment, the sun peeked over the mountaintops, illuminating not only my splendid nakedness, but the bus for the Christian Women's Society.

speaker: Martin
text: They went to a nude beach?

speaker: Niles
text: No, and neither did I.  Uh, the next few minutes are a blur, as I zig-zagged my way back to the car, while being pelted with driftwood and Bibles.  Needless to say, Island Niles died on that beach.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, honey.  Will he ever be back?

speaker: Niles
text: Maybe at Christmas.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, all. [_sees Niles_] Oh, Niles, welcome back.

speaker: Claire
text: Hi, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Claire.

speaker: Claire
text: Did you get your luggage?

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh, no.  They didn't have it.  Uh, could I see you in the kitchen for a minute?

speaker: Claire
text: Sure.

speaker: Daphne
text: OK, Mr. Crane, it's time for your exercises.

speaker: Martin
text: Already did 'em.

speaker: Niles
text: When have you ever done your exercises before lunch?

speaker: Martin
text: Claire and I did 'em together.  She has a way of making them seem like fun!

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah, well, if they're fun they're not really working, but all right!

speaker: Martin
text: Actually, Claire says-

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, shut up.

speaker: Claire
text: If we need privacy, it's either very good or very bad.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it's-it's not so good, I'm afraid.  Uh, I realize this is sudden.  It's just that I've been tossing and turning for the last several days, and I just can't keep going like this.

speaker: Claire
text: Well, what are you talking about?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Claire, I'm talking about... parting ways.  I'm sorry.

speaker: Claire
text: It's over?  Just like that?

speaker: Frasier
text: Claire, I realize how painful this must be for you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ow!  You kicked me!

speaker: Claire
text: Well, you dumped me!

speaker: Frasier
text: I said I was sorry!

speaker: Frasier
text: OW! _Reset to: Hallway Niles and Daphne are standing outside the elevator in each other's arms._

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I guess I'll go home and take down the hammock.  I love you, darling. [_kisses her_]

speaker: Daphne
text: I love you, too.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello?  Hello, Roz.  The wrong beach, really?  Thanks for the warning, that would have been embarrassing. _The elevator doors close.  As Daphne stands there shaking her head, Claire comes out and tearfully pushes the button._

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, see you later.

speaker: Claire
text: Well, actually you won't.  Frasier just dumped me.

speaker: Daphne
text: What?  What happened?

speaker: Claire
text: I honestly don't know!  I was having such a good time, and... now I'm out here.  I-I don't even know what went wrong! _As she starts to sob, Daphne feels no impulse to hug her, but leans forward sympathetically._

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, um, I'm sorry.

speaker: Claire
text: I really liked him.  I liked all of you so much.  I was starting to feel like part of the family.  I was... hoping we'd end up like sisters.

speaker: Daphne
text: Sisters?

speaker: Claire
text: I never had a sister, [_voice breaks_] just brothers.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_voice breaks_] Same here! _They hug each other, sobbing.  Reset to: Living Room Frasier limps out of the kitchen._

speaker: Martin
text: What the hell happened?  Claire just ran out of here without even saying goodbye.

speaker: Frasier
text: We broke up.

speaker: Martin
text: What?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I broke up with her.

speaker: Martin
text: You are a piece of work, aren't you?  You just couldn't stand a good thing, could you?  I bet you were planning on this since Belize.

speaker: Frasier
text: I have not!

speaker: Martin
text: Ah, don't give me that.  You did the same thing you always do: you go around asking everybody's advice, then you just do whatever the hell you want - and it's usually wrong, by the way!

speaker: Frasier
text: Look, I was just being true to my feelings, Dad.  There's no reason to be mad at me.

speaker: Martin
text: I'm not mad at you.  I'm mad at myself.  I knew this was coming and I let myself get attached.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm sorry, Dad.  Claire's great, it's just she's not the right person for me.  Daphne knows! [_to her_] Will you tell him?

speaker: Frasier
text: OW!  Would you people stop doing that! **CHEESE AND SYMPATHY** _Scene Five - Lana's House Lana opens the door to Frasier and Roz, bearing gifts._

speaker: Lana
text: Oh, come in! [_sees gifts_] Oh, you didn't have to do this!

speaker: Roz
text: [_as she takes them, to Frasier_] Told you. _They come in.  The room is occupied by Kirby and a group of his high school friends._

speaker: Frasier
text: I sense a scholar in our midst! [_shakes Kirby's hand_] Ha-ha, congratulations, Kirby!  Let's see the sheepskin!

speaker: Kirby
text: Dude!  Wait until the party gets going a little.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_trades a look with Roz, then_] Good thinking.  I'll just, uh, see what your mother's doing. [_goes to kitchen_]

speaker: Kirby
text: Hi, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Kirby.

speaker: Kirby
text: Got our prom pictures back.

speaker: Kirby
text: I had them retouched a little.  You're smiling in them now.

speaker: Roz
text: [_looking at the pictures_] I notice you also have your hand on my ass.

speaker: Kirby
text: Where?  Oh, you mean now.  Do you not like it?

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I'm having a devil of a time with this cheese can.

speaker: Lana
text: Just hold the nozzle close to the cracker so you make a little flower, like this. [_does_] Here, try one. [_feeds him the cracker_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Mmm, well, I can honestly say that is the best canned cheese I've ever had. [_they laugh_] Lana, listen, there's something I'd like to talk with you about.

speaker: Lana
text: If this is about Claire, I already know.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh gosh, I'm so sorry, it's just I-

speaker: Lana
text: Frasier-

speaker: Frasier
text: She's a perfectly wonderful girl-

speaker: Lana
text: You don't have to explain it to me.  I mean, sometimes you just don't feel it.  That's OK.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?  I thought you'd be mad at me.

speaker: Lana
text: Well, why would I be mad?  I mean, it's not like I get a commission on every match I make. [_laughs_]

speaker: Frasier
text: So, we're OK?

speaker: Lana
text: Well, sure we're OK.  We're better than OK.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right.  Better than OK.

speaker: Girl
text: [_o.s._] You total _slut_!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh.  Oh no, Roz.  Uh... [_gets up_] _He goes out into the living room, and sees Kirby being braced by his ex-girlfriend, Kristi, who has just arrived with one of her friends._

speaker: Kristi
text: You told me not to come because this was just gonna be some boring party with your mom's friends!

speaker: Kirby
text: Roz is my mom's friend!

speaker: Kristi
text: She was your prom date!

speaker: Kirby
text: ...Damn, baby, why you got to be this way?  I'm trying to show you respect by keeping you from seeing my other lady!

speaker: Roz
text: I was never his lady!

speaker: Kirby
text: Damn, baby, that's cold.

speaker: Kristi
text: She's old enough to be your mother practically!

speaker: Roz
text: Damn, baby, now THAT'S cold.

speaker: Kristi
text: Whatever!

speaker: Kirby
text: Wow.  That did not go so great.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, those things rarely do, Kirby.

speaker: Bob
text: Hey, buddy!

speaker: Kirby
text: Dad, you're here!

speaker: Bob
text: Oh, I wouldn't miss it for anything! [_hugs his son_] Where's Mom?  I really need to talk to her.

speaker: Kirby
text: I'll go get her. [_exits_]
